# Open Standard for Software Agents (OSSA) - The OpenAPI for Software Agents

> **The industry standard for production-ready AI agent systems** - Built for enterprise adoption

> OSSA v0.3.5 transforms the specification into **the definitive OpenAPI for Software Agents**, enabling companies to build vendor-neutral, production-grade AI agent infrastructure with enterprise compliance built-in.

> OSSA is a **specification standard** (like OpenAPI for REST APIs), not a framework. It defines contracts and metadata for production agent systems (security, governance, portability), enabling vendor neutrality, cost optimization, and future-proof architecture.

This repository contains the complete specification, CLI tools, SDKs, and 100+ reference examples. OSSA provides standardized YAML schemas for defining software agents, their capabilities, triggers, and lifecycle management. It enables vendor-neutral agent definitions that work across LangChain, LangFlow, CrewAI, AutoGen, Temporal, n8n, and other platforms.

## Core Specification

- [OSSA Schema v0.3.5](https://openstandardagents.org/schemas/v0.3.5/ossa-0.3.5.schema.json): Complete JSON Schema for agent definitions (Latest)
- [OSSA Schema v0.3.4](https://openstandardagents.org/schemas/v0.3.4/ossa-0.3.4.schema.json): Previous stable version
- [OpenAPI Specifications](openapi/): API definitions for agent communication and discovery
- [Specification Documentation](spec/v0.3.5/): Complete specification with examples and guides

## Quick Start

- [Installation Guide](README.md#-quick-start): Install via npm and create your first agent
- [Quick Start Guide](docs/QUICKSTART.md): Get started in 5 minutes
- [API Reference](docs/api-reference/): Complete API documentation
- [Examples Directory](examples/): 100+ reference implementations

## CLI Tools

- [CLI Commands](bin/ossa): Command-line tool for validation, generation, and migration
- [CLI Documentation](docs/api-reference/endpoints.md): Complete CLI reference
- [Validation Guide](docs/guides/getting-started.md): How to validate OSSA manifests

## SDKs

- [TypeScript SDK](src/sdks/typescript/): Type-safe client library with full validation
- [Python SDK](sdks/python/): Python client library (Pydantic models, CLI, validation)
- [SDK Documentation](src/sdks/README.md): SDK usage and examples

## Examples

- [Agent Manifests](examples/agent-manifests/): Basic agent definitions
- [Platform Adapters](examples/adapters/): Integrations with LangChain, CrewAI, etc.
- [Multi-Agent Workflows](examples/multi-agent/): Complex orchestration examples
- [Reference Implementations](examples/reference-implementations/): Production-ready patterns

## Migration Guides

- [Migration System](migrations/README.md): How to migrate between OSSA versions
- [v0.3.4 to v0.3.5](spec/v0.3.5/MIGRATION-v0.3.4-to-v0.3.5.md): Complete migration guide (100% backward compatible)
- [v0.3.2 to v0.3.3](migrations/guides/MIGRATION-v0.3.2-to-v0.3.3.md): Skills Compatibility Extension
- [Migration Runner](migrations/index.ts): Automated migration tool

## Development

- [Contributing Guide](CONTRIBUTING.md): How to contribute to OSSA
- [Code of Conduct](CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md): Community standards
- [Security Policy](SECURITY.md): How to report vulnerabilities
- [Development Setup](README.md#-development): Setup instructions

## Specification Versions

- [v0.3.5](spec/v0.3.5/): Latest version - The OpenAPI for Software Agents (10 major features)
- [v0.3.4](spec/v0.3.4/): Previous stable version
- [v0.3.3](spec/v0.3.3/): Legacy version with Skills Compatibility Extension
- [Schema Index](spec/): All specification versions

## OpenAPI Specifications

- [Agent CRUD](openapi/agent-crud.yaml): Create, read, update, delete agents
- [Agent Discovery](openapi/agent-discovery.yaml): Discover and query agents
- [Agent Communication](openapi/agent-communication.yaml): Agent-to-agent messaging
- [Agent Identity](openapi/agent-identity.yaml): Identity and authentication
- [CLI Commands](openapi/cli-commands.openapi.yaml): CLI API specification
